incidents.title: Major Ransomware Attack on Brazilian Healthcare Network
incidents.description: A sophisticated ransomware group targeted Brazil's second-largest healthcare network, affecting 15 hospitals across SÃ£o Paulo state. The attack encrypted patient records and disrupted emergency services for 48 hours, forcing hospitals to operate on manual backup procedures.

incidents.title: Data Breach at Mexican Financial Institution Exposes 2M Records
incidents.description: A major Mexican bank suffered a significant data breach exposing personal and financial information of over 2 million customers. The breach was caused by an unpatched vulnerability in their online banking platform that had been exploited for several weeks before detection.

incidents.title: Colombian Government Websites Hit by DDoS Campaign
incidents.description: Multiple Colombian government websites were taken offline by a coordinated DDoS attack lasting 6 hours. The attack disrupted critical citizen services including tax payments, document processing, and public information access.

incidents.title: Supply Chain Attack Targets LATAM E-commerce Platforms
incidents.description: A sophisticated supply chain attack compromised a popular payment processing library used by multiple e-commerce platforms across Latin America. The malware was designed to steal credit card information during checkout, affecting thousands of online transactions.

incidents.title: Argentine Energy Company Targeted by Industrial Cyber Attack
incidents.description: An Argentine energy distribution company reported a targeted cyber attack on their industrial control systems. The attack attempted to manipulate SCADA systems to disrupt power distribution but was detected and contained by security teams before causing outages.

trends: Ransomware attacks continue targeting healthcare infrastructure in LATAM

recommendations: Implement zero-trust architecture to limit lateral movement in ransomware attacks
Enhanced third-party risk management for supply chain security
Accelerate patch management programs, especially in financial services
Strengthen DDoS mitigation capabilities for public-facing services
Increase investment in OT/ICS security for critical infrastructure
analysis.weeklyInsight: This week saw a significant escalation in attacks against critical infrastructure across LATAM, with healthcare and energy sectors being primary targets. The sophistication of attacks, particularly the supply chain compromise affecting e-commerce platforms, indicates well-resourced threat actors focusing on maximum economic impact. Organizations should prioritize resilience planning and assume breach scenarios.
